talk.author: did:plc:jsv4bjrr6di2er7k2huhrsl2
talk.utter: That's one of the things that keeps me in comics, the things I work on generally get released. Can't imagine how demoralising it must be at times.

talk.author: did:plc:ggoujcszegvaaq5bhmog4cvw
talk.utter: Agreed. I had one comic unreleased (Kalifornia adaptation), that was enough. Did boards for Pixar for a shelved project, but it was only  a few months work and a good experience overall. Still disappointing though. But itâ€™s very common with movies.

talk.author: did:plc:jsv4bjrr6di2er7k2huhrsl2
talk.utter: The number of screenwriters I know with scripts that went nowhere...

talk.author: did:plc:jsv4bjrr6di2er7k2huhrsl2
talk.utter:
Or you can do comics and be poor but people see your stories!!

Wait, why is that the better one again?

talk.author: did:plc:ggoujcszegvaaq5bhmog4cvw
talk.utter: I was well paid for the Pixar stuff but it's a shame no one will see it. But that's most film work, even if the film is released only a fraction of the boards and concepts ever see the light of day.

talk.author: did:plc:jsv4bjrr6di2er7k2huhrsl2
talk.utter: I'm not even allowed to put up a jpeg of the poster I did that you can see IN The Marvels!

talk.author: did:plc:jsv4bjrr6di2er7k2huhrsl2
talk.utter: I'm not even allowed to put up a jpeg of the poster I did that you can see IN The Marvels!

talk.author: did:plc:jsv4bjrr6di2er7k2huhrsl2
talk.utter: And at the same time, they never made it available to buy. So it's annoying I can't just stick up a low res jpeg.
